    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(App app,
              Level levelObj,
              int xCoordinate,
              int yCoordinate,
              int[] colourScheme,
              java.lang.String player)
        Constructor for Player class. Keeps track of everything a player has (e.g. score, parachutes, fuel, shield, etc.) and contains a Tank object.
        Parameters:
        app - is the App object that we will pass through to allow for drawing + more implementations of the PApplet library.
        levelObj - is the Level object which a Player object belongs to.
        xCoordinate - is the x-coordinate of a player on the screen.
        yCoordinate - is the y-coordinate of a player on the screen.
        colourScheme - is the RGB colour scheme of a player.
        player - is the String for the player's name, i.e. "A" for Player A, "B" for Player B, etc.

      • setParachute

        public void setParachute(int parachute)
        While the parachute feature is not an extension, I have implemented an extension feature where the number of parachutes increases when the key 'p' is pressed.
        Parameters:
        parachute - is the number of parachutes that we want our parachute number to set or update to.

      • increaseScore

        public void increaseScore(int increase)
        Increases the player's score. Call when the player has hit another tank.
        Parameters:
        increase - is the number we want our score to increase by.

      • displayFuel

        public void displayFuel()
        Displays the amount of fuel left in the top left corner.

      • displayParachute

        public void displayParachute()
        Displays the number of parachutes left in the top left corner.

      • displayShield

        public void displayShield()
        Displays the number of shields left in the top left corner. This is an extension feature of my program.

      • drawShield

        public boolean drawShield()
        Draws the shield, which disappears after 25 frames. This is an extension feature of my program.
        Returns:
        true if executed, false if otherwise.

      • drawParachute

        public boolean drawParachute()
        Draws the parachute on the tank. While the parachute feature is not an extension, I have implemented an extension feature where the number of parachutes increases when the key 'p' is pressed.
        Returns:
        true if executed, false if otherwise.
